channel.title: [Non-SRL] Dead Link's AutoCurser
channel.description:
This is a simple auto curser without anti-randoms Works like a charm for me The script is quite basic - No includes as well But its quite anti-ban as well The monster is clicked at a different part each time The curse spell is also clicked at random parts Smooth mouse movements
It provides info on time running, xp gained and no. of times cursed
You have to make sure that -Monster is in non-multi combat zone -Caged monsters preferred -You have the right number of runes -Make sure to glance at the screen every 30 seconds for anti-randoms
Suggestions for best results -Do it on the mage of zamorak in varrock castle -Be wearing armour that gives you highest amount of negative mage attack bonus so that you miss each spell ( you still get the same amount of xp ) -Switch private chat to off but public can be on ( You wont be able to reply to pvt chat but can do it to public )
You are allowed to modify and mess around the script as long as you don't sell the modified/original version and give me credit for the original version

item.title: [Non-SRL] Dead Link's AutoCurser
item.dc:creator: @Ramzz2 Ramzz2
item.description:
@Ramzz2 wrote:

I tried it but my mouse just spazed on the monk of zamorak

Read full topic

item.title: [Non-SRL] Dead Link's AutoCurser
item.dc:creator: @WhoCares357 WhoCares357
item.description:
@WhoCares357 wrote:

The way it clicks and moves the mouse is detectable. As it clicks with one milisecond, ClickMouse is very detectable.

Rather do this:

HoldMouse(x, y, true); Wait(10+random(20)); ReleaseMouse(x, y, true);

Or just use SRL. MoveMouse is also detectable.

Read full topic

item.title: [Non-SRL] Dead Link's AutoCurser
item.dc:creator: @dead_link dead_link
item.description:
@dead_link wrote:

I dont understand how its detectable ?
It clicks on a random part each of the book, spell and monster each time
The target is not fixed

And I did not know that the MoveMouseSmooth and ClickMouse are detectable ones

Could u suggest another one that will help me in moving the mouse around and clicking

Read full topic

item.title: [Non-SRL] Dead Link's AutoCurser
item.dc:creator: @WhoCares357 WhoCares357
item.description:
@WhoCares357 wrote:

Please do not use this script. It will get you banned. Here’s a little piece of it:

Wait(100); MoveMouseSmooth(x,y); //Move to monster Wait(100); ClickMouse(x,y,True); //Click monster done:=done+1; //Update done wait(1000); //Wait one second

He uses ClickMouse and MoveMouse which are very detectable. The fact that he doesn’t have Anti-Randoms should result in a realization already.

If you want to get banned go ahead and use the script :D.

Read full topic

item.title: [Non-SRL] Dead Link's AutoCurser
item.dc:creator: @dead_link dead_link
item.description:
@dead_link wrote:

This is a simple auto curser without anti-randoms
Works like a charm for me
The script is quite basic - No includes as well
But its quite anti-ban as well
The monster is clicked at a different part each time
The curse spell is also clicked at random parts
Smooth mouse movements

It provides info on time running, xp gained and no. of times cursed

You have to make sure that
-Monster is in non-multi combat zone
-Caged monsters preferred
-You have the right number of runes
-Make sure to glance at the screen every 30 seconds for anti-randoms

Suggestions for best results
-Do it on the mage of zamorak in varrock castle
-Be wearing armour that gives you highest amount of negative mage attack bonus so that you miss each spell ( you still get the same amount of xp )
-Switch private chat to off but public can be on ( You wont be able to reply to pvt chat but can do it to public )

You are allowed to modify and mess around the script as long as you don’t sell the modified/original version and give me credit for the original version
